title: Are chances of succeeding in life increased if in school you were either the best or the worst? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think, mathematically, the best have much more chance of slipping as they start a new phase of life. The worst have much more chance of comparatively improving. The latter speaks to my personal experience. By the time I left high school I looked undistinguished among my peers. But by age 30 I had caught up with them economically and surpassed 90% of them by retirement.

When I was in highschool, we had provincial final exams and you could see classrooms of with students with higher grades working hard after school preparing for these exams. The students who didn’t attend on average had lower grades. So I think that a good or bad school is important but is less important than the effort you put in as a student.
